translation: Dhāraṇī of Jeweled Wisdom Spoken by the Buddha

source_sentence: 西天譯經三藏朝散大夫試光祿卿
translation: Tripiṭaka of the Western Translation of the Sutra, Chaozan Dashi, and Guangluqing

source_sentence: 明教大師臣法賢奉　詔譯
translation: Mingjiao dashi ministers, Faxian, in accordance with the imperial edict, translated
Thus I have heard.

source_sentence: 一時佛在舍衛國祇樹給孤獨園。
translation: One time, the Buddha was staying at Anāthapiṇḍada Park in Jeta Grove in Śrāvastī.
He was accompanied by a large assembly of bodhisattvas.

source_sentence: 是時有大夜叉主名曰寶賢。
translation: At the time, there was a great lord of the nightshades named Baoxian.
He came to the Buddha.
When he arrived, he bowed his head and faced his feet.
He put his palms together in respect, and said to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 世尊我有大祕密心陀羅尼樂欲宣說。
translation: "Bhagavān, I have a great secret mental dhāraṇī that I'd like to teach.
Please let the Bhagavān take pity on me and protect it.
Bhagavān, this is a dhāraṇī.

source_sentence: 若有比丘比丘尼優婆塞優婆夷等。
translation: Suppose there are monks, nuns, laymen, and laywomen who wholeheartedly recite it three times a day.
recite it wholeheartedly three times a day, I'll always be a support for them.
I'll always be a support for that person.
They'll attain good fortune in all endeavors.

source_sentence: 乃至飲食衣服臥具金銀珍寶財穀等我常供給。
translation: I'll always provide food, drink, clothing, bedding, and gold, silver, jewelry, and provisions.

source_sentence: 及作一切勝利悉使成就。
translation: I'll also create all kinds of excellent benefits that will be fully achieved.

source_sentence: 亦令一切人眾普得愛敬。
translation: I'll also cause all people to universally love and respect him.

source_sentence: 唯除婬怒癡等惡不善法。
translation: Only bad and unskillful things like lust, anger, and delusion are excluded.
All the other works are done as they wish.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊知此寶賢大夜叉主誠心信重。
translation: The Bhagavān then knew that this jeweled, great lord of the yakṣas was sincere and faithful.

source_sentence: 為欲安樂一切眾生貧苦惱故。
translation: It was because he wanted to bring comfort to all sentient beings who were poor and afflicted.
He told him.
"It's good, Venerable Jeweled One, the great lord of the yakṣas.
It's for the benefit of all sentient beings.
I'd also like to hear it explained as I see fit.'
It was then that the great jeweled lord of the yakṣas explained the dhāraṇī.
He then explained the dhāraṇī.
He said.

source_sentence: 那謨(引)囉怛那(二合)怛囉(二合)夜(引)野(引一)那謨(引)摩(引)尼跋捺囉(二合)野(二)摩賀(引)藥叉西那鉢多曳(三)薩曳替曩(四)呬哩摩(引)尼跋捺囉(二合五)呬哩呬哩摩(引)尼跋捺囉(二合六)枳哩摩(引)尼跋捺囉(二合七)枳哩枳哩摩(引)尼跋捺囉(二合八)唧哩摩(引)尼跋捺囉(二合九)唧哩唧哩摩(引)尼跋捺囉(二合十)祖路摩(引)尼跋捺囉(二合十一)祖路祖路摩(引)尼跋捺囉(二合十二)祖嚕摩(引)尼跋捺囉(二合十三)祖嚕祖嚕摩(引)尼跋捺囉(二合十四)覩嚕摩(引)尼跋捺囉(二合十五)覩嚕覩嚕摩(引)尼跋捺囉(二合十六)酤嚕摩(引)尼跋捺囉(二合十七)酤嚕酤嚕摩(引)尼跋捺囉(二合十八)蘇嚕摩(引)尼跋捺囉(二合十九)蘇嚕蘇嚕摩(引)尼跋捺囉(二合二十)薩哩嚩(二合)阿哩湯(二合)彌娑(引)達野莎(引)賀(引二十一)怛[寧*也](切身)他(引二十二)鉢多泥(二十三)蘇鉢多泥(二十四)蘇嚕彌(二十五)蘇末帝(二十六)蘇囉替(二十七)速剎摩(二合)閉呬哩計(引二十八)呬哩哥(引)哩(二十九)布蘭尼(二合引)悉馱跋捺哩(二合三十)呬哩呬哩莎(引)賀(引三十一)伊呬酤(引)儞瑟計(二合三十二)伊呬細(引)儞瑟計(二合引三十三)伊呬虞(引)尼瑟計(二合)莎(引)賀(引三十四)是時寶賢大夜叉主。
translation: 那謨(引)囉怛那(二合)怛囉(二合)夜(引)野(引一)那謨(引)摩(引)尼跋捺囉(二合)野(二)摩賀(引)藥叉西那鉢多曳(三)薩曳替曩(四)呬哩摩(引)尼跋捺囉(二合五)呬哩呬哩摩(引)尼跋捺囉(二合六)枳哩摩(引)尼跋捺囉(二合七)枳哩枳哩摩(引)尼跋捺囉(二合八)唧哩摩(引)尼跋捺囉(二合九)唧哩唧哩摩(引)尼跋捺囉(二合十)祖路摩(引)尼跋捺囉(二合十一)祖路祖路摩(引)尼跋捺囉(二合十二)祖嚕摩(引)尼跋捺囉(二合十三)祖嚕祖嚕摩(引)尼跋捺囉(二合十四)覩嚕摩(引)尼跋捺囉(二合十五)覩嚕覩嚕摩(引)尼跋捺囉(二合十六)酤嚕摩(引)尼跋捺囉(二合十七)酤嚕酤嚕摩(引)尼跋捺囉(二合十八)蘇嚕摩(引)尼跋捺囉(二合十九)蘇嚕蘇嚕摩(引)尼跋捺囉(二合二十)薩哩嚩(二合)阿哩湯(二合)彌娑(引)達野莎(引)賀(引二十一)怛[寧*也](切身)他(引二十二)鉢多泥(二十三)蘇鉢多泥(二十四)蘇嚕彌(二十五)蘇末帝(二十六)蘇囉替(二十七)速剎摩(二合)閉呬哩計(引二十八)呬哩哥(引)哩(二十九)布蘭尼(二合引)悉馱跋捺哩(二合三十)呬哩呬哩莎(引)賀(引三十一)伊呬酤(引)儞瑟計(二合三十二)伊呬細(引)儞瑟計(二合引三十三)伊呬虞(引)尼瑟計(二合)莎(引)賀(引三十四)是時寶賢大夜叉主。
After speaking this dhāraṇī, he said.
He again said to the Buddha.
"Bhagavān, this is the dhāraṇī.
'Suppose someone recites it seven times according to the Dharma.

source_sentence: 是人所作勝利皆得成就。
translation: That person's actions will achieve great rewards.

source_sentence: 又復有人於白月十五日潔淨持戒。
translation: "Furthermore, on the fifteenth day of the white moon, a person purifies and observes the precepts.
Three times a day, he burns incense made of deep sandalwood.
He recites this dhāraṇī 8,000 times over.

source_sentence: 是人隨願獲得金銀珍寶悉皆如意。
translation: That person obtains gold, silver, and jewelry as they wish, all as they desire.
It was then that the great lord of the yakṣas declared this dhāraṇī.

source_sentence: 說是陀羅尼已禮佛而退。
translation: After reciting this dhāraṇī, he paid homage to the Buddha and withdrew.
After the Buddha spoke this sūtra.
The multitude of bodhisattvas who heard what the Buddha taught rejoiced greatly and believed and handed it down.
They were all greatly delighted and faithfully accepted and handed it down.
Dhāraṇī of Jeweled Wisdom Spoken by the Buddha
